getResources.description: Returns the available child resources. Currently, the only child resource is the Projects Resource.

getProjects.description: Returns the projects accessible to the API user, as well as links to project sub-resources for discovery.

getProject.description: GET returns detailed information about the specific project, as well as links to related resources.

getEventSchemas.description: GET returns schema information for all the event collections in this project, including properties and their type. It also returns links to sub-resources.

addEvent.description: POST inserts an event into the specified collection.

writeKey.description: The Write Key for the project.

addEvents.description: POST inserts multiple events in one or more collections, in a single request. The API expects a JSON object whose keys are the names of each event collection you want to insert into. Each key should point to a list of events to insert for that event collection.

writeKey.description: The Write Key for the project.

count.description: GET returns the number of resources in the event collection matching the given criteria. The response will be a simple JSON object with one key: a numeric result.

readKey.description: The Read Key for the project.

event_collection.description: The name of the event collection you are analyzing.

filters.description: Filters are used to narrow down the events used in an analysis request based on event property values.

timeframe.description: A Timeframe specifies the events to use for analysis based on a window of time. If no timeframe is specified, all events will be counted.

interval.description: Intervals are used when creating a Series API call. The interval specifies the length of each sub-timeframe in a Series.

timezone.description: Modifies the timeframe filters for Relative Timeframes to match a specific timezone.

group_by.description: The group_by parameter specifies the name of a property by which you would like to group the results.

countUnique.description: GET returns the number of UNIQUE resources in the event collection matching the given criteria. The response will be a simple JSON object with one key: result, which maps to the numeric result described previously.

readKey.description: The Read Key for the project.

event_collection.description: The name of the event collection you are analyzing.

target_property.description: The name of the property you are analyzing.

filters.description: Filters are used to narrow down the events used in an analysis request based on event property values.

timeframe.description: A Timeframe specifies the events to use for analysis based on a window of time. If no timeframe is specified, all events will be counted.

interval.description: Intervals are used when creating a Series API call. The interval specifies the length of each sub-timeframe in a Series.

timezone.description: Modifies the timeframe filters for Relative Timeframes to match a specific timezone.

group_by.description: The group_by parameter specifies the name of a property by which you would like to group the results.

minimum.description: GET returns the minimum numeric value for the target property in the event collection matching the given criteria. Non-numeric values are ignored. The response will be a simple JSON object with one key: result, which maps to the numeric result described previously.

average.description: GET returns the average across all numeric values for the target property in the event collection matching the given criteria. Non-numeric values are ignored. The response will be a simple JSON object with one key: result, which maps to the numeric result described previously.

sum.description: GET returns the sum if all numeric values for the target property in the event collection matching the given criteria. Non-numeric values are ignored. The response will be a simple JSON object with one key: result, which maps to the numeric result described previously.

selectUnique.description: GET returns a list of UNIQUE resources in the event collection matching the given criteria. The response will be a simple JSON object with one key: result, which maps to an array of unique property values.

funnel.description: Funnels count relevant events in succession.

readKey.description: The Read Key for the project.

steps.description: A URL encoded JSON Array defining the Steps in the Funnel.

multiAnalysis.description: Multi-analysis lets you run multiple types of analysis over the same data. Performing a multi-analysis call is very similar to a Metric or a Series.

readKey.description: The Read Key for the project.

event_collection.description: The name of the event collection you are analyzing.

analyses.description: A URL encoded JSON object that defines the multiple types of analyses to perform.

filters.description: Filters are used to narrow down the events used in an analysis request based on event property values.

timeframe.description: A Timeframe specifies the events to use for analysis based on a window of time. If no timeframe is specified, all events will be counted.

interval.description: Intervals are used when creating a Series API call. The interval specifies the length of each sub-timeframe in a Series.

timezone.description: Modifies the timeframe filters for Relative Timeframes to match a specific timezone.

group_by.description: The group_by parameter specifies the name of a property by which you would like to group the results.

extraction.description: GET creates an extraction request for full-form event data with all property values. If the query string parameter email is specified, then the extraction will be processed asynchronously and an e-mail will be sent to the specified address when it completes. The email will include a link to a downloadable CSV file. If email is omitted, then the extraction will be processed in-line and JSON results will be returned in the GET request.

readKey.description: The Read Key for the project.

event_collection.description: The name of the event collection you are analyzing.

filters.description: Filters are used to narrow down the events used in an analysis request based on event property values.

timeframe.description: A Timeframe specifies the events to use for analysis based on a window of time. If no timeframe is specified, all events will be counted.

email.description: Email that will be notified when your extraction is ready for download.

latest.description: Use this parameter to specifically request the most recent events added to a given collection. Extract up to 100 of your most recent events.
